name: market for hard coal | hard coal | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/971/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'hard coal', in the geography of Latin America and the Caribbean.;This dataset covers the average transport distance specific to the domestic market of hard coal in Latin America, which is assumed to be 200km by rail. Dust from transport and load/unload operations is included. Average coal losses are considered. Average emissions to water due to leaching from coal heaps at storage is estimated from the literature.;hard coal' is a fossil fuel with a calorific value of 27.91 MJ/kg. It is used as a solid fuel and is sourced from coal mines after crushing, screening and washing the coal. Its main applications are in the following sectors: domestic fuel (mainly for hand-fired stoves), as filter media and as an ingredient in charcoal briquettes.

This activity starts at the hard coal preparation plant with the beneficiated coal ready to be loaded on rail, truck, barge or conveyor.

activity end: The activity ends with the unloading of hard coal at domestic consumers or export hubs.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/05:Mining of coal and lignite/051:Mining of hard coal/0510:Mining of hard coal

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Transport distances are geography specific, losses and related emissions are generic values applicable worldwide.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Transport data geography specific, emissions, losses, energy and land requirements are generic assumptions.

exchanges.description:
Assumption by Dones et al.: per one time of unloading from transport mode, (storing) and loading on subsequent transport mode an average demand (electric) energy of 7.2 kWh/tonne and an average land use demand of 1m2*a/tonne is required.
Reference(s):
Dones, R., Bauer, C., Röder, A. (2007) Kohle. In: Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. Final report ecoinvent No. 6-VI, Paul Scherrer Institut Villigen, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

Calculated by default as TOC (gC) = COD/2.7 (COD measured in g O2). Should more correctly be calculated from the carbon content of the specified emissions to water.

Assumption by Dones, R., Bauer, C., Röder, A. (2007) Kohle. In: Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. Final report ecoinvent No. 6-VI, Paul Scherrer Institut Villigen, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

Assumption by Dones, R., Bauer, C., Röder, A. (2007) Kohle. In: Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. Final report ecoinvent No. 6-VI, Paul Scherrer Institut Villigen, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

The average transport distance for export coal from Latin America (mostly from Colombia) is estimated to be 800km. This corresponds to the rail transport of coal between the city of La Dorada in the mining area of central Colombia and the port of Santa Maria at the Colombian Coast (VDKI, 2017). The average transport distance for import coal to Latin America is assumed to be 200km, also by rail, and is covered in this market dataset. The rest is covered in the datasets "hard coal, import from RLA".
Reference(s): Verein der Kohleimporteure. 2017. Jahresbericht 2017. Accessed online at: http://www.kohlenimporteure.de/files/user_upload/jahresberichte/vdki_jahresbericht_2017.pdf, 15 November 2017.
